description:
Agata Pilip is a freelance designer and architect with strong interests in interior design, fashion, branding and graphics. Her experience and skills focus on developing of innovative concepts for brand environments and translating brand identity into spatial- and graphic design.
She studied architecture and urban planning in Wroclaw University of Technology (Wroclaw, Poland) and TU Muenchen (Munich, Germany) and in 2010 she started a Master Programme in Interior and Retail Design at the Piet Zwart Institute in Rotterdam, which she follows till present.
When she is not designing, she reads a lot, travels, bakes cupkaces and attempts to learn how to surf.
Coolhunter in the Hospitality & Luxury Coolhunt research project, in cooperation with Institut Paul Bocuse & Emlyon Business School, Lyon, France.

I’m a graduated student at the Faculty of Economics in Skopje, Macedonia. I’m born in Gevgelija. I spend most of my free time on the net, surfing, chatting, meeting new people, looking for new and unusual stuff that can’t be seen in my country… Despite the net I like to go out with my friends, have fun and go for a long walk in nature. I love the nature and maybe that’s the reason why most of my examples were related with the trend Eco cool. Now I try to write for all trends that seem interesting to me. I also tried to write some poetry, but I had to leave that behind because of my studies. I’m really happy that I have a chance to be one of the Top bloggers. Coolhunting is my hobby and I'll keep hunting the coolest things I can find.
"A Malayustralianmutt with a background in nomadic world wandering and photomedia
"Ann is director of trendspotting at JWT
CE - IEMES student - Loves organizing and festivals - Tilburg Spint.
Coolhunter in the Hospitality & Luxury Coolhunt research project, in cooperation with Institut Paul Bocuse & Emlyon Business School, Lyon, France.
Ph. D. Assist. Prof.n Isik University, Faculty of Economics and Administrative Sciences Department of Management, Istanbul.

Born and grew up in Beijing. Studied in Canada. An economist, a former banker, a yogini, an urban nomad, a self-taught fashion designer…...and a Cool hunter. Loves travelling around the world to find inspiration. Manages “ChicPanda”, a website that shows the world the “Cool” in China.
"Hae In Lee is a senior at Seouls Hong Ik University
Strategy and Insights Director of creative publishing studio Right Angle.

Bart is recognized as one of the China blogging experts with Science of the Time. He passionately curious and loves Shanghai. He analyses valuable insights, in depth knowledge with a methodological but still pragmatic approach to reach trends and also for putting elusive ideas into words. His contributions point to an inquisitive mind with a wide range of interests and endless curiosity.  Please drop him a note, he loves to connect.

Elisabetta Borghi -“Betty” Borghi is a brand marketing strategist and a creative thinker. She was initiated by her mom to be a traveler, a fashion trend setter, a gourmet and a wine passionate, an Italian espresso drinker. For this reason once grown up, She started to discover the world living in Spain, US and Uk. Betty likes exchanging different cultural perspectives, innovations, fashion and design, cooking, sailing and would transform her passions into a successful career soon. She is keen on helping companies to succeed, understanding the customer’s needs and behaviors and above all understanding emerging trends. Formerly marketing communication manager, product manager, export - buyer for FMCG, Fashion, Luxury Goods and ICT top multinational marketing teams in Europe. Recently she appeared as a student at EMLUX Executive Master at Università Cattolica del Sacro Cuore in Milan, Italy, were Marco Pedroni and Carl discovered her abilities as a coolhunter, leaving her happy to train her brain.

Carl Rohde leads Science of the time since 1992. Trendwatching & Coolhunting are his professional passion.  Not gadgets so much but Validated Cool Mentality Trends. Because Validated Cool Mentality Trends form the only solid platform for Real Innovations. Rohde is also professor Trendwatching & Innovation at Fontys Universities, the Netherlands. He is into broadening the Science of the Time network with interesting people: from young aspiring beginners to highly reputated experts and professors. Over the years he has worked with a caleidoscope of international brands and companies.

Trendwatcher & Editor in Chief of fashion, food & lifestyle magazines, lifestyle-magazines. Coolhunting coordination across the hippest cities in Europe. Radio and television presentations on trends and fashion. Fashion features in leading national and international magazines. Design and fashion lecturing and workshops across Europe. Independent journalist, trendwatcher, photographer.

Caroline Hagood is a poet and writer living in New York City. She writes on arts and culture for Salon, the Huffington Post, Film International, Think MTV, Film-Philosophy, Bookslut, Flavorwire, and The Journal of Popular Culture, among others. She has also written a collection of poetry and a novel.
Coolhunter in the Hospitality & Luxury Coolhunt research project, in cooperation with Institut Paul Bocuse & Emlyon Business School, Lyon, France.
Coolhunter in the Hospitality & Luxury Coolhunt research project, in cooperation with Institut Paul Bocuse & Emlyon Business School, Lyon, France.

Chantal Pasker (1992) is currently studying 'Trendwatching & Concept Development' at Fontys Academy for Creative Industries. She started her own blog Rabbit Shaped Clouds to keep you updated about new concepts. She is currently doing an internship at Science of the Time.

After a bachelor in Taiwan I went to Milan almost 4 years ago. With a fashion designer background I'm now studying Fashion Management on the Milan Fashion Institute. Always like to experience different things and keep an open mind.
Designer, Trend analyst and researcher, Design research, Innovation

Hi, I am Claire. 

With a Bachelor's degree in Humanistics and a completed Master's in Design Cultures, I moved my residence from Amsterdam to Berlin. Since then, I have become active as a freelance (copy) writer and editor. More specifically, I now predominantly write and edit for a variety of Dutch, Italian and American fashion magazines, e.g Glamcult, 2DM, Prestage, CREEM, The WILD Magazine and CODE, among others. 
I've always had a knack for words and ever since I was very young, I have invariably been a 'fashion-o-phile' and clothes aficionado. 

On a theoretical level I am particularly interested in fashion's relation and interaction with its cultural and societal embedment. As such, I strongly believe that fashion, design and style are not mutually exclusive from the social and cultural issues that impact our world. Similarly, I love mixing genres -fashion, design, art, environmental issues and societal developments- and in so doing, I always attempt to propose an "incongruous" point of view. 
Accordingly, in my last thesis, I laid bare today's fanatical vogue for vintage fashions. It is these retrogressive, nostalgic cultural phenomena I find hugely fascinating and wish to research further one day. 

Other interests lie within a more personal nature, such as my beloved cat, my dear boyfriend and my close circle of friends. Besides this, I am an overzealous blogger (to be viewed via: http://www.touteslesplusbelles.tumblr.com) and a fervid documentary lover (whereby virtually any topic holds my interest). 

Website: http://www.clairevandenberg.com

Clara (Barcelona, 1986) is studying nowadays Art at The Royal Academy of Art (KABK) in The Hague, Netherlands, where she decides to move after her postgraduate study “Cool hunting 09” at Ramón Llull University, Barcelona. Her focus is in photography and video with what she tries to capture human behaviour, life style and identity. Her old fashioned contemporary style does not let her decide between the analogue and the digital. Her addiction to discover and rediscover a city keeps her inner curiosity growing constantly. She describes her-self as a travel lover. However, her natal city is always in her mind.
Cool Editorial Staff is used by Carl, Ingeborg, Thomas and others working at Science of the Time HQ.
Coolhunter during the SPECO minor create your future experience

Diddo is an artist, designer and inventor whose work spans the spectrum from 
engaging conceptual art to intriguing product design.
"Don Ryun Chang was born to diplomat parents and grew up on five continents - Asia
Active participant in diverse NGO’s, small business coordinator, blogger for http://www.scienceofthetime.com. Generally a very outgoing person always eager to learn, searching for new experiences.

Jose Eduardo Garcia de Souza is a Senior Partner Ayr Consulting, a company specialising in Trends and Innovation based in Lisbon - and (most probably) because of his long name everybody he knows calls him “Duca”. At an early age he fell in love with Advertising and practised it for nearly 30 years (27 of them with Ogilvy) in 5 countries: Brazil (where he was born), England, Spain, Portugal and Kazakhstan - always in Client Services and with a heavy strategic slant to it. Training is another passion of his, and he has been involved with it for more than 15 years, be it as Training Leader at the offices he worked, be it giving sessions and organising Training Courses and Seminars. Outside work his other passions are cinema, books, motor racing and food. He has a great wife, a great son and a stammer.
Coolhunter in the Hospitality & Luxury Coolhunt research project, in cooperation with Institut Paul Bocuse & Emlyon Business School, Lyon, France.

Born in Taiwan, based in Taipei/Berlin/ Hamburg. He has studied sociology in Taiwan and modern art theory in Europe. During the last ten years, he has lived in Colchester, London, Prague, Berlin, Hamburg. In 2006, Emerson Wang was invited by Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism of the Republic of Korea to work as visiting researcher/curator at National museum of contemporary art, Seoul. He is business development manager/ Executive editor for art plus magazine. (ARTMAP media from Hong Kong).

Erica Bol works as a trend researcher.  She likes to be BOLD; search for the new, look for the unknown and touch the untouchable. By analyzing all sorts of trends and cultures Erica is able to provide important insights and make interesting new connections. With her studio Boldin she helps organizations make the translation from trends to brands. She provides information on what the future holds in stock and how companies can successfully anticipate and use these changes. She is also involved in the curriculum development at the Fontys Academy (International Lifestyle Studies) where she teaches students to become trend professionals.
Erica gets inspired through her frequent travels and experiences abroad (she lived and worked in the US and China). They allow her to observe different customs and cultures. Both help to discover how and why people navigate through their tangible and intangible worlds in every day life.

Farid Tabarki is the director of Studio Zeitgeist which conducts/coordinates research and develops projects on the local, national and European Zeitgeist. Studio Zeitgeist works on themes like radical decentralisation, radical transparency, (social) media, politics, generations, aesthetics, Europe and education. It has developed projects for, amongst others, MTV, Hyves, TEDxRotterdam, The City - European Centre for Culture and Debate in Belgrade, Philips and the Dutch Ministry of Social Affairs and Employment.

Recently Farid has co-founded the Finishing School, an education institute that primarily focuses on teaching broad knowledge, etiquette and empathic leadership with ʻhigh potentialʼ twenty & thirtysomethings as its target audience. He's also (guest) lecturer at Erasmus University Rotterdam (International Bachelor Communication and Media) and Fontys University of Applied Sciences (Academy for Creative Industries).
Earlier Farid was editor-in-chief and researcher for Coolpolitics – a Dutch civic social organisation that encourages younger generations to shape and develop their role as citizens and works towards building Dutch, European and global civil society. In 2006 and 2007, he presented the parliamentary election edition of MTV Coolpolitics, which was broadcasted live on TMF and MTV Benelux. Currently he’s the presenter of the television programme Dare to Think, from Socrates to Sartre.

He was awarded Trendwatcher of the Year in 2012.
Student at Fontys International Lifestyle Studies.

I study International Aquatic Eco Technology at Zeeland University of Applied Sciences. Shortly said this is International Water Management. My area of expertise is sustainability and innovation and those topics might be more specified in subjects as ecology, chemistry, biology, and geology. Besides that I have worked in restaurants as a cook for six years and therefor have a big affinity with food. In my spare time I like to do things that give me an existential reason to live. What those things are I will leave to your imagination.
Coolhunter in the Hospitality Coolhunt research project, in cooperation with TSI University, Barcelona, Spain.
Coolhunter from Milan Fashion Institute

Hebert Gouvea, Artista Visual, Professor Universitário na ESAMC Campinas (SP) e no Centro Universitário Padre Anchieta em Jundiaí (SP), membro  do Grupo Pparalelo de Arte Contemporânea de Campinas.

Bacharelado Artes Visuais pelo IA / Unicamp, possui especialização em Arte Contemporânea pela mesma entidade. Seu foco de pesquisa examina limites entre a Arte e o Design de Moda a partir da seleção de obras de Arte e coleções de Moda desde a década de 1960 até a contemporaneidade, com foco no dado escultural e performático que ambas se apresentam. Neste contexto, estuda Tendências de Moda dentro do contexto social,  analisando o comportamento dos indivíduos consumidores, as respostas do mercado e o circuito artístico.

Estimulado por tudo aquilo que se apresenta como potencialmente estético: a cidade, os passantes, roupas, cartazes, Arte, música e boas histórias. Em constante movimento entre a Arte e o Design, procura em seus trabalhos tensionar os limites de ambos, em busca de uma melhor sinergia entre a práxis artística e a complexidade dos princípios formais do Design e da Moda.
"Director of Northern Projects as well as freelance translator and editor. Based in Tokyo. After having learned Politics at SOAS (University of London)
Coolhunter in the Hospitality Coolhunt research project, in cooperation with TSI University, Barcelona, Spain.
An International Lifestyle Proffesional!

Ingeborg is a trendresearcher that likes to share her insights through different channels: on and offline, as writer, lecturer. Her curious and (over)active attitude makes that she discovers many social movements, soft spots and inspiring stories that are linkable to different generations/target-groups.
Coolhunter in the Hospitality Coolhunt research project, in cooperation with TSI University, Barcelona, Spain.

A technocreative entrepreneur with a long past as 360 marketing strategist (ATL, BTL, Direct and Digital), software developer, account manager and CEO for big direct/interactive agencies. More than 16 years of experience in the advertising industry in international markets (Venezuela, Mexico & Spain), including the management of multiple regional offices (Europe, Asia/Pacific & Latinamerica). He has been CEO & Founder for several agencies such as Estratego, OgilvyOne, Ogilvy Interactive and Rapp Collins in Venezuela. Currently living in Madrid, Spain, where he is CEO for a technomarketing agency called Mediamorphosis, Creative director for a comic called Entrepreneuras and Representative/Impresario for Science of the Time in Spain.

Janus de Visser is a social media specialist and Internet sociologist. In the search to answer questions he tries to differ from the suspected outcomes and isn’t afraid to state the socially unacceptable. After a year working at Science of the Time he is now one of their bloggers and is social media consultant for educational and governmental organizations.

Hello! My name is Jessica, 24 years old and I live in Eindhoven together with my boyfriend Rob and my dog Noah.  My hobbies are: listening to music (I also play the piano), hanging out with friends, shopping, watching TV, reading, fashion and travelling. I also love discorvering new things and go on new adventures!

B. Joseph Pine II is an internationally acclaimed author, speaker, and management advisor. A Visiting Scholar with the MIT Design Lab, he co-founded Strategic Horizons LLP to help businesses conceive and design new ways of adding value to their economic offerings. A prolific writer, in 2011 he updated his best-selling book The Experience Economy with James H. Gilmore and  with Kim C. Korn co-wrote Infinite Possibility: Creating Customer Value on the Digital Frontier, which introduces a new framework called the Multiverse that shows how to use digital technology to stage experiences that fuse the real and the virtual.

An explorer, a researcher, a wanderer; Joey Dembs is currently fulfilling his dream and passion of conducting Chinese youth research in what is currently the world’s largest population: China. Joey is a Research Analyst at enoVate, a Chinese youth insights and design firm. He has conducted creative research projects in China for global companies including Unilever, Kraft, Wrigley, Sprite and numerous local clients. He is the managing editor of enoVate’s blog, and has contributed articles to global and consulting agency, PSFK. Please contact him regarding information about enoVate’s capabilities at joey(at)enovatechina(dot)com.
Author of 'The Green Marketing Manifesto' and 'The New Marketing Manifesto', co-founder of St. Luke's, the award winning socially aware London ad agency.

Josh has been at the forefront of grassroots marketing in the United States for over a decade. He has developed and led culture-driven marketing campaigns for brands such as Mazda, Scion, Reebok, XBox, T-Mobile, Dr Pepper, and numerous entertainment and music brands. His work has been highlighted in Forbes, Brand Week, Advertising Age, Wall Street Journal, GQ, and Motor Trend, among others, as well as the books Mind Your Xs and Ys: Satisfying the 10 Cravings of a New Generation of Consumers, The Power of Real-Time Social Media Marketing, and Coolhunting Digital. His specialty is helping major brands break the status quo in a variety of marketing disciplines, from social media to street teams and events to integrations into art, music, fashion, and other niche lifestyle segments. Josh is a member of Vistage, MENG, and WOMMA, and serves on the marketing and strategic planning committees for the UCLA Alumni Association. In a previous life, Josh was a music journalist and founded a music management company. He started his career while writing about hip hop for UCLA’s Daily Bruin and has been published in such publications as the Source, Vibe, XXL. Josh graduated from UCLA with a degree in Linguistics and Psychology, and earned a certificate in Business Management from USC’s Marshall School of Business. He lives with his wife, Christie, and baby boy Justin, in Los Angeles and enjoys yoga, biking, green tea, and wine, although never at the same time.

I see and feel the world thru my nose. I shape the forms of imagination thinking of its sensorial experience and every take in oxygen is a new inspiration. I particularly enjoy contrasts... it's because of contrasts that there are no absolutes... and that is graceful. Sometimes I call myself professional sniffer.. but it sounds better to say that I design sensorial branding since 1998. And oh...I'm still so in love with it. It's an everyday synesthesic exercise of smelling the sound, tasting the words and listening to the fragrances. Human emotions are curious and fantastic, but what really fascinates me are the sensations - they are the primitive perception, where the senses are truly touched. Before working with the senses, I've worked in automobile Design & Engineering. My dream was to be a designer at Pinifarina, but quickly changed the auto grease and components to molecules and dreams. I was born in Brazil, my parents came from Uruguay, and great parents from France, Germany and Spain. This nomadic mixture gave me a perception that world is a tiny little community full of stories to participate and collaborate... so that's why I'm here.

Juliana Zanettini is a fashion designer who lives in Sao Paolo. After some years working as fashion designer, she's now a trend forecaster, providing consulting services to companies in different fields aside from fashion such as design, architecture and advertising. She has also a Master Program in Design and teaches Coolhunting on FAAP University, in Sao Paolo.

Kees Elands started as an art director in the advertising industry. For last 10 years he worked together with Carl on various projects. In 2006 he founded TrendsActive. Their mission is to help organizations to use trends as an added value for their business (strategy, positioning and product development ). He is specialised in interpretating socio- cultural trends for various international brands, consulting how to interpretate and implement relevant trends in businesses. Unique is their strategic and creative methodology what makes this new way of trend interpretation really imaginative and thorough. TrendsActive works for clients like: Asics, Tetra Pak, Belgacom, The Coca Cola company, Ikea. In 2010 he won the Second Sight TWOTY (Trendwatcher of the Year) award for best trend implementation agency.
Coolhunter in the Hospitality Coolhunt research project, in cooperation with TSI University, Barcelona, Spain.
Coolhunter during the Minor Create Your Future.

I am born as Lars Charas and still operating under this name in the year 2011. Although a little bit more grey and drowned with new knowledge and experience I am still playful and am trying to look as this world as if it was my first day on this beautiful planet. Food and agriculture is my passion; our common future and sustainability my drive; arts and woman my inspiration!

I have developed new methods that show how our  food will change coming years.  Trust me, many things we take for granted now, will have other forms in the near future. Understanding those transitions give you a glimpse on future trends and new possibilities for investments.

I am not interested in today or yesteryear, but mainly focus on tomorrow. I hope you enjoy my thinking and hope you help me create a new world.

Pleasure to meet you, I'm Lin. I'm a second year International Lifestyle Studies student  fascinated by everything social and green made by people trying to transform our world in something positive and beautiful. I enjoy sharing these foundings through my blog. In the future I'd love to write trendbooks and use this literature to create new concepts to help our world.

Linda is expert in Mass Communication and Food. After several years consulting the food industry about communication strategy, now she is lecturer Food at International Lifestyle Studies, Fontys Academy for Creative Industries.

Luis Rasquilha is founder and owner of Ayr Consulting, Trends and Innovations, a Scienceofthetime company. He has more than 10 years experience in Marketing, Communication and Brand issues working in Advertising Agencies (Publicis, Ogilvy, Dentsu/Caetsu, WOP). He is also university professor in Portugal, Belgium and France. Specialties: Branding, Advertising & Strategy, Trends, Marketing Communication, Management & Innovation
Maaike Rijnders is lecturer trendwatching at Fontys Academy for Creative industries in Tilburg, Holland. She is especially interested in trends in entertainment and event business.

Born and grew up in Eindhoven, The Netherlands. Lived at the carribean for a while.

Artist (drawing). Into fashion, food and fitness. Loves to travel.
Convinced vegetarian. Listening to R&B, Soul and Hip-Hop music.

Gratuated as (Graphic) Media Designer and studying International Lifestyle Studies at this moment.

Marco Pedroni is a sociologist and a qualitative researcher based in Milan. He works in the Centre for the Study of Fashion and Cultural Production of the Università Cattolica of Milan. He carries out teaching duties within the Milano Fashion Institute and the Istituto Marangoni.
As researcher, he's specialized in the study of social trends through an ethnographic approach both off- and online. Quite eclectic, he's currently working on gambling, fashion blogs, immigration, and the evolution of retailing, being convinced that 'Sociology is a fighting sport' - a continual fight to always question common sense, living on the street to interview the first passerby learning each time something new.</p>
He’s published articles and essays on the creative professions and fashion, and the book <a href="http://marcopedroni.wordpress.com/coolhunting/" target="_blank">Coolhunting</a>. Genesis of a Heretical Professional Practice (FrancoAngeli, Milan, 2010). He's been coordinating the Cool Milano Hunt since 2010, within the Cool City Hunt project launched by Science of the Time.
Mac addict without hope, he spends his free-time reading western comics, writing and performing theatre drama, and playing hide and seek with his son.
Coolhunter in the Hospitality & Luxury Coolhunt research project, in cooperation with Institut Paul Bocuse & Emlyon Business School, Lyon, France.

Maria Cristina Pavarini is a fashion and costume journalist. She is an expert in the young, sportswear, jeanswear and textile markets, and works as Senior Features Editor for the fashion magazine Sportswear International. She lives in Milan, Italy, and speaks fluent English, German and Spanish.

Marian Salzman is the President of Euro RSCG Worldwide PR, North America. She took over in 2009, bringing laser-like focus to the agency's social media and grassroots campaigning, a homecoming, as she had previously spent five years as Chief Strategic Officer of Euro RSCG Worldwide. Author of 'The Future of Men'.
Coolhunter in the Hospitality & Luxury Coolhunt research project, in cooperation with Institut Paul Bocuse & Emlyon Business School, Lyon, France.

English author and journalist Mark Simpson is credited/blamed for coining ‘metrosexual‘ in an essay titled ‘Here come the mirror men’ in the UK’s Independent newspaper in 1994. Compounding his crime, Simpson introduced his insufferably pretty offspring to the US in 2002, naming David Beckham as the prime exemplar and starting the current global epidemic of metrosexmania. Simpson is also attributed with introducing us to the ‘retrosexual’ (in the sense of the anti-metrosexual).
Coolhunter from Fontys International Event, Music and Entertainment Studies. 22, I Love Music, regular concertvisitor, 2nd year IEMES-Communicatie, Tilburg!
Coolhunter in the Hospitality Coolhunt research project, in cooperation with TSI University, Barcelona, Spain.

Matsume is a Canadian born Japanese living in Shanghai for the last 10 years. Her day-job is a Creative Stylist for Beijing Hair Culture. She's been here since a time when Shanghai's life was just starting to be re-influenced by the West. She grew with the city so is best placed to know what's going on. Through the salon she meets successful clients from all industries. Combined with her sociable life style that led her to be very knowledgeable about Trends and Lifestyle.
Trainee Research at Science of the time
Former intern at Science of the Time, Mediena is now a Coolhunter in Science's network.
Coolhunter in the Hospitality Coolhunt research project, in cooperation with TSI University, Barcelona, Spain.

Graduated in Advertising & Marketing, and with Trends and Innovation Management Experience, currently I am a Coolhunter, Blogger and Trend Researcher for Science of the Time.

Besides being a teacher in the Trends and Innovation area, I am also a freelancer, and I consider myself a Marketrender (Fusion between a Marketeer and a Trends Researcher), therefore using insights obtained from the analysis of the mentality consumer behaviors and converting them into brands’ innovation.
22, IEMES-Communicatie student, Tilburg.
Iam assiatant professor in knitwear design palnning to do Phd. in fashion

I'm Bsc. in Marketing student, with a strong interest in research. I seek to understand change that surrounds us everyday and has a significant impact on culture and society, and by that help add something new to the comprehension of the world we live in. 

Interests: Innovation Management ,Marketing Strategy, Consumer Neuroscience, Social Media Marketing, Consumer Behaviour, Psychology of Consumption, Physics, Astrophysics
"Navneet Taori works for Bodhtree

address: 32/24 Khuông Việt, phường Phú Trung, quận Tân Phú
postalcode: 70000, 32/24 Khuông Việt, phường Phú Trung, quận Tân Phú

description: Norbert Mirani has more than 10 years experience at Science of The Time. He is working at Sanoma Media Netherlands B.V. He is also associated with The Brandfuel Academy. Education: economics, and social sciences (cum laude). He wrote many articles online and offline, is author and co-author of several books on trends and brands. Together with Carl Rohde and Goos Eilander (Trendbox) he wrote the book Dossier Supertrends. Norbert can be found at conferences as moderator and/or speaker.

I'm a Fashion and Textile Designer and I'm becoming a cool hunter. I'm attending a Master in Fashion Management/ Brand and Product Innovation at Milano Fashion Institute. For me is very important and interesting to look for new trends and ideas as I'm willing to create original products that can be easily accepted and followed, mostly for its original, functional and cool attributes. I love fashion since I have memory, so I'm here to learn and grow.
"Patricia Mereilles is a Public Relations graduate

Paula Albejante used to work with marketing at Siemens and recently start to work with independent film (documentary). Formed in Advertising and Marketing at ESPM (Escola Superior de Propaganda e Marketing), postgraduate in Documentary Cinema at FGV (Fundação Getúlio Vargas).

Paulo Al Assal is founder and CEO at Voltage, leading behavioral and trends research agency in Brazil; Bachelor Degree in Business Administration and Economics from Colorado State University; Masters in Marketing from New York University; Has worked in the financial area for banks such as: Banco Itamarati, Banco Sudameris; Co-founded Impact Sports Marketing, a sports marketing firm in Brazil; At Voltage, Paulo led projects for companies like: Unilever, GM, Philips, Carrefour, Wal Mart, ABN AMRO Bank, Nivea, Red Bull, Coca Cola Company, Diageo, among others. Paulo is a Lecturer on themes such as Branding, Trends, Human Behavior.

I'm attending a master course in fashion retail at  Milan Fashion Institute.
I am graduated in Human sciences( Arts, music and Media) at Unibg.
I have a blog about fashion http://nonsonounfashionblogger.blogspot.com/
i love arts, media, music and all things that gimme more than upset my mind.
I am curious and unsatisfied about all the simple things.
 ALWAYS ASK ME " WHY?"
MY BELIEVE IS THIS:
"Normal is a word we've heard all my life. All 'should' be normal, but no one can explain what it means.
Everyone is afraid of what is strange.
Being curious means to be different, unique. "
Coolhunter from Fontys ACI; International Event, Music and Entertainment Studies.
Student, living in Antwerpen (BE)
Coolhunter in the Hospitality & Luxury Coolhunt research project, in cooperation with Institut Paul Bocuse & Emlyon Business School, Lyon, France.
upnext.nl is a media concepting agency devoted to positive change.

I am a Cool Hunter and  I'm specialized in fashion product management.
Particularly interested in fashion product management, Pr, events, business networking, marketing-communication, web 2.0 and nanotechnologies.

Quinsy Gario was born in Curaçao and raised in St. Maarten, Curaçao and the Netherlands. With a focus on gender and postcolonial issues he writes, consults, performs, gives workshops, produces events and makes art installations and video clips under the banner of NON EMPLOYEES. Besides being a blogger for Science of the Time he is also an editor at the feminist journal LOVER, a member of MC Theater's MakersLab and a member of the pan African art collective State of L3. In June 2011 he also initiated the art project Zwarte Piet Is Racisme, for which he and three others were arrested in november 2011.

Rahim is currently an entrepreneur for hire (freelancer) bridging the gap between Business and IT with his services. Rahim is a professional with experience ranging from entrepreneurial ventures to corporate environments. Prior to assuming this position he served as a consultant for diverse projects within the field of IT project management at Tilburg University. His main areas of expertise are management consulting, workflow management, information management, IT auditing, software project management, requirement analysis and software engineering. Currently he's working on a web-development project for Science of the Time. In this project he's mainly responsible for building the backend information system for advanced business analytics, e-commerce system and such.

I'm currently studying International Event, Music and Entertainment Studies at the Academy for Creative Industries in Tilburg. I'm also president of non profit organization Super Youth who's organizing several times a year special events for children who are battling with cancer or who have won, in the age 10 up to 21 years. 

After my study I would like to work in the entertainment industry at a television or film production company like Disney or the belgian company Studio 100.

In my spare time I really like to act in theatre and on screen, I'm following singing lessons and a jazz dance class. If there is enough time I will go horseback riding on our horse. I really like these things because you have the freedom to do what you like and want to do at that moment and I think thats the most important thing to do in life, to dream and do what you like and want to do.

IF YOU COULD ASK ME TREE QUESTIONS ABOUT THE FUTURE, WHAT WOULD THOSE BE? 

Sanny Zuiderveld is a Moderator, Researcher and Writer who helps individuals and organizations to prepare for what the future might hold in store for them. Some call her: ‘creatrix for what’s next’. She is known for merging solid research and creativity to develop insightful and inspiring new ways to success. 

She is a Dutchy from origin and left beautiful Amsterdam in 2007 to live the American dream in her favorite city New York. She spends her free time exploring her new hometown the Dutch way: by bike. She brings her camera everywhere and loves to observe how people use and experience their surroundings.

You will find more of her outlook on what’s going on around us, now and possibly in the future, both in print and online. In books: ‘Diagnose 2025’ (2010) about the future of healthcare and ‘Oog voor de Toekomst’ (2005) on marketing and consumers in a changing society, nominated for best marketing book 2005 and referred to in the book “Scenarios for Success” by Sharpe and Van der Heijden. 
In magazines: e.g. citywhisper.net, Trend Magazine Second Sight, Holland Management Review, Kluwer Communicatiedesk, Retail Visie and European Finance and Marketing Association Magazine.

For Science of the Time, she shares Cool things from her daily live and from the research for her current projects; in 2012: shopping, feminization, health and New York City.
Coolhunter from Fontys ACI; International Event, Music and Entertainment Studies.

Sónia Laima (1970) is a journalist and video content designer. Founder of «Rebel Zone, Creatives Industries» - a media laboratory based in Lisbon, Portugal, that brings together brands and cool creators - Sónia believes it’s all about an inspiring message. She has a great experience in media, where Sonia was deputy editor-in- chief, content developer and journalist in TV programs as well as in press backgrounds. She's now turning attention for digital platforms and the many possibilities they offer. Master in Migrations and Globalization trends by UNL Lisbon, Sónia Laima is specialized in identity studies/ stereotyping. She was invited to follow for Ph.d. Urban nomad, Sónia enjoys crossing boundaries between the many different art forms and media.

My name is Stephania; I’m 24 years old, graduated in Fashion Business in Brazil. I live in São Paulo - one of the best cities for fashion in Brazil, our stylists are already reference in the world.
Ever since I was a little kid a cared about fashion, always loved to see what happened on catwalk, what was cool to wear on the magazines, and dreamed of being a model, but I never got tall enough to be one. So when it was time to go to college I decided to do something I‘ve always been passionate about, Fashion.
After college I’ve worked in a couple places that teach me a lot of things about fashion, for example in   a high luxury fashion store, and one of the biggest press offices of fashion in Brazil (where I could know all about what was coming next on the greatest magazines of fashion), and participating of a blog that talks about fashion with a few friends where I write every week.
Beside fashion, I really love travelling, what I do almost every year during my vacations so I can meet new places and other cultures what people dress up like, what they usually do. During college a took a semester in Spain, and traveled a lot and learned to speak Spanish.
Other thing that it’s on my”favorite things to do” list it’s to eat I’m addicted to candies, so if you ever come to Brazil and want to know a nice place to eat a candy here I am to indicate you some places.

He likes music, hard copy books, printed newspapers and inches thick magazines as much as he loves gadgets. His journalistic approach to trend research helps him to focus on deeper lines, instead of hypes of the day.
"What, how, why" is important, "who's involved and why" is key.

I am Chinese girl from Beijing. Recently I just started my MBA at Simon Fraser University in Vancouver. I love sports.Swimming and basketball are the two keywords in my childhood and teenagehood memory. Music is the love of my life and I’m recently teaching myself play piano. I’m also interested in languages, cultures, travelling, Japanese animation and dramas, skiing, hiking…and Coolhunting!

Tom is Psychologist of the Future. He wants to show people the beauty of now and the potency of tomorrow. His first book, 'De Seizoenen van de Tijdgeest' (The Seasons of the Zeitgeist') came out in 2009. Tom has his own consultancy, and divides his time between writing, trend presentations and strategic organizational advice.
Speaker, Trendwatcher & co-founder at Scienceofthetime.com

Vincent is a cognitive neuroscientist and writer from the Netherlands. He looks at current thought in psychology and neuroscience and tries to get an idea of where these rapidly maturing fields are going. He believes the biggest contribution of both sciences will arrive in the form of a new understanding of humanity, in which the role of non-conscious processes in human action is embraced, as well as the interaction between individuals and their surroundings. This new view could lead to a second Enlightenment, that celebrates reason without losing touch with what it means to be human.

His blog posts will focus on new research that illustrates these ongoing trends, but will also reflect on how a new understanding of humanity would affect law, politics and society as a whole.

This is Zepha. To provide you with an accurate mental picture of this wonderful being a three dimensional approach would be most suitable.   1. Professional- After a thriving high school career the world opened up all it’s wonderful possibilities to the then 18 year old girl. Driven by a desire to make more sense of the world she chose to do a bachelors in Social Psychology in Utrecht, learning all about people’s behavior, attitudes, group dynamics and social culture. As intriguing as this all was, she could not resist the forces pulling her towards creative and art-oriented environments and ended up doing a masters in Creative Design Processes. This led to the ultimate discovery that advertising, creative design, art&technology; and culture development offer her the perfect combination between art and people. 2. Private - Although having been trapped in the maze of education for most of her life, Zepha managed to develop some interests on the side as well, celebrating the love for music by visiting concerts and festivals, cultivating a great taste in food and drinks while socializing &c. After exiting the Maze of Tuition she took on a love for traveling and ended up in Wellington, New Zealand after living in Antwerp and exploring Europe.   3.Transcendent - In a realitiy not yet acknowledged in our society Zepha is an amazing ballet dancer as well as a multi-award winning pastry chef. She travels around the world giving both lectures as well as private coachings since she is believed to know everything. The travel time she is saving since she developed the first working Teleport prototype she uses writing both fiction and non-fiction in every possible language.
